title: Bookkeeper (JMS-F)
description:
Overview

We are seeking a detail obsessed Bookkeeper who thrives on accuracy, structure, and closing the books on time. This role is foundational to our financial operations. You will own the integrity of our general ledger and ensure leadership has clean, reliable financial data every month. Your success is measured by one simple outcome: pristine books closed by the 10th of each month.



Primary Focus

‚Ä¢ Accuracy, data integrity, and timeliness

‚Ä¢ Reliable month end close with zero surprises



Key Deliverable

‚Ä¢ Fully reconciled, audit ready books finalized by the 10th of each month



Responsibilities

QuickBooks Online and General Ledger Management

‚Ä¢ Own and maintain the General Ledger in QuickBooks Online

‚Ä¢ Ensure the Chart of Accounts is accurate, current, and well structured

‚Ä¢ Code and clear bank and credit card feeds daily



Month End Close

‚Ä¢ Execute a complete monthly hard close

‚Ä¢ Reconcile all bank, credit card, and suspense accounts

‚Ä¢ Post all required journal entries and adjustments

‚Ä¢ Deliver clean, finalized financial data to the Finance Manager by the 10th



Accounts Payable

‚Ä¢ Manage the full A/P lifecycle from bill entry to payment

‚Ä¢ Verify approvals and ensure proper documentation

‚Ä¢ Prepare and execute weekly payment runs

‚Ä¢ Maintain positive and current vendor relationships



Accounts Receivable

‚Ä¢ Generate and send customer invoices accurately and on time

‚Ä¢ Record and apply incoming payments

‚Ä¢ Monitor aging and manage collections on overdue accounts



Record Maintenance and Compliance

‚Ä¢ Maintain organized digital records for all receipts and invoices

‚Ä¢ Ensure audit readiness at all times

‚Ä¢ Enforce proper expense categorization and compliance with company policies



Payroll and Sales Tax

‚Ä¢ Post payroll journal entries when applicable

‚Ä¢ Record, file, and reconcile sales tax in accordance with local regulations



Additional Responsibilities

‚Ä¢ Process employee reimbursements and manage recurring expenses.

‚Ä¢ Reconcile merchant accounts and payment platforms (Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, Amazon).

‚Ä¢ Prepare weekly financial reports for U.S. leadership.

‚Ä¢ Coordinate with U.S.-based finance, operations, and leadership teams to resolve discrepancies or gather missing documentation.

‚Ä¢ Support external CPA or tax preparers by providing requested documentation.

‚Ä¢ Ensure compliance with U.S. GAAP standards and internal financial policies.



Requirements

‚Ä¢ 2‚Äì3 years of bookkeeping or accounting experience supporting U.S. companies.

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of U.S. GAAP and U.S. accounting workflows.

‚Ä¢ Proficiency with QuickBooks Online; experience with additional platforms such as Xero or NetSuite.

‚Ä¢ Strong Excel/Google Sheets skills.

‚Ä¢ Excellent English communication skills, written and verbal.

‚Ä¢ Ability to work U.S. business hours or maintain partial overlap.

‚Ä¢ Reliable internet connection and secure remote working environment.



Preferred Qualifications

‚Ä¢ Experience with e?commerce platforms, subscription billing, or multi?channel sales data.

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with U.S. payroll processes.

‚Ä¢ Experience working with distributed or offshore teams.

‚Ä¢ Accounting degree or equivalent education, preferred.



How to Apply

‚Ä¢ Please include a link to your resume and your preferred wage per hour in USD.



What Success Looks Like

‚Ä¢ Books closed on time, every time

‚Ä¢ Reconciliations completed without last minute clean up

‚Ä¢ Financial data leadership can trust instantly

‚Ä¢ Processes that scale cleanly as business grows



Schedule

‚Ä¢ Monday - Friday, 7:00am - 1:00pm PST

title: Bookkeeper/US Tax Preparation
description:
About the Role:



We are seeking a detail-oriented, reliable Bookkeeper to manage and maintain accurate financial records in QuickBooks Online, and also prepare taxes for US a client. This role will support day-to-day bookkeeping needs, perform periodic cleanups, and work closely with leadership on monthly bookkeeping and reporting. The ideal candidate is highly organized, proactive, and comfortable collaborating to resolve questions quickly and keep the books current and clean.



Key Responsibilities:



Bookkeeping & General Ledger

‚Ä¢ Maintain accurate books in QuickBooks Online (QBO), including accounts payable and accounts receivable processes

‚Ä¢ Record, categorize, and reconcile transactions across bank accounts, credit cards, and other financial accounts

‚Ä¢ Ensure consistent and accurate coding of expenses and income

‚Ä¢ Monitor and address uncategorized transactions in a timely manner



QuickBooks Cleanup & Maintenance

‚Ä¢ Perform QuickBooks cleanup work as needed, including identifying and correcting errors, duplicate entries, miscategorized transactions, and inconsistencies

‚Ä¢ Review account balances for accuracy and resolve discrepancies

‚Ä¢ Maintain a clean chart of accounts and ensure proper use of classes, locations, and tags (if applicable)



Preparation of US Taxes

‚Ä¢ Support US tax filings, including monthly reconciliations, clean general ledger coding, and organized documentation for all income, expenses, and balance sheet accounts.

‚Ä¢ Coordinate and compile all tax-ready reporting packages for review and filing, including annual financial statements, detailed general ledger exports, and supporting schedules for key accounts.

‚Ä¢ Prepare partnership tax support schedules, including tracking owner capital accounts and distributions, and compiling the information needed to produce accurate Schedule K-1s (and related workpapers) for partners/members.



Month-End Close & Reporting

‚Ä¢ Work in tandem with leadership on monthly bookkeeping and close processes

‚Ä¢ Prepare monthly financial reports, including Profit & Loss, Balance Sheet, and Cash Flow (as needed)

‚Ä¢ Support basic variance analysis and flag unusual transactions or trends

‚Ä¢ Assist with accruals, prepaid expenses, and month-end adjustments (as applicable)



Communication & Collaboration

‚Ä¢ Collaborate closely with leadership and respond quickly to bookkeeping questions or clarifications

‚Ä¢ Communicate clearly about what‚Äôs needed, what‚Äôs missing, and what‚Äôs completed

‚Ä¢ Maintain a structured process for documentation, receipts, and transaction notes to keep bookkeeping organized and audit-ready



Qualifications

‚Ä¢ 2+ years of bookkeeping experience (or equivalent)

‚Ä¢ MUST HAVE: experience with K1 forms and preparation of US taxes

‚Ä¢ CPA is nice to have

‚Ä¢ Strong QuickBooks Online proficiency required

‚Ä¢ Demonstrated experience with QuickBooks cleanup or ‚Äúcatch-up‚Äù bookkeeping

‚Ä¢ Solid understanding of bookkeeping principles, account reconciliation, and month-end close

‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate closely with leadership

‚Ä¢ High attention to detail, accuracy, and consistency



HOW TO APPLY:

‚Ä¢ Please include a link to your resume (not portfolio) along with your preferred wage per hour in USD



What Success Looks Like

‚Ä¢ Books are accurate, organized, and up-to-date in QuickBooks

‚Ä¢ Month-end close is smooth and predictable with minimal surprises

‚Ä¢ Questions are resolved quickly through clear, consistent communication

‚Ä¢ Cleanup issues are proactively identified and corrected, not just recorded

‚Ä¢ Taxes are filed on time, along with K1 forms and completed accurately and detailed.



Schedule

‚Ä¢ Casual schedule (as needed by client)

title: Part-Time Accountant - CPA (Remote)
description:
About Everyday Dose:



Everyday Dose is a functional coffee brand focused on better energy, focus, and wellness. We operate across DTC, retail, and eCommerce channels and are building scalable financial operations to support continued growth.



About the Role



We are seeking a detail-oriented and highly trustworthy Bookkeeper to support our day-to-day accounting and administrative operations. This role focuses on accounts payable, credit card management, and retail remittance tracking, with the opportunity for expanded responsibilities as the business grows.



This is a remote, part-time position requiring availability aligned with US Central Time. The ideal candidate can commit to 3‚Äì4 hours per day, 5 days per week, with the opportunity for increased hours in the future if mutually agreeable.



Key Responsibilities



Accounts Payable:

‚Ä¢ Monitor the accounting inbox and manage incoming vendor communications

‚Ä¢ Forward invoices to bill pay platforms and ensure proper routing and documentation

‚Ä¢ Review vendor statements and resolve discrepancies, including missing invoices and payment confirmation issues

‚Ä¢ Respond to vendor inquiries regarding invoice and payment status

‚Ä¢ Draft invoices for internal review as needed

‚Ä¢ Validate invoices against internal schedules to ensure proper classification and period alignment

‚Ä¢ Set up new vendors, including collecting payment details, tax forms, and required business information

‚Ä¢ Follow up internally on unapproved invoices and reroute or resolve issues as directed



Credit Card & Expense Management:

‚Ä¢ Sync receipts and transactions to QuickBooks Online once submitted by internal staff

‚Ä¢ Monitor transactions and follow up on missing receipts or incomplete documentation

‚Ä¢ Identify aged transactions or out-of-policy spend and escalate appropriately

‚Ä¢ Support month-end close activities related to expenses and credit cards



Retail Remittance & Reporting:

‚Ä¢ Download retail remittance files from the accounting inbox

‚Ä¢ Save and organize files in Google Drive following established conventions

‚Ä¢ Log remittance details into a running tracking file to maintain accurate records



Required Tools & Technical Skills:

‚Ä¢ Must be a CPA

‚Ä¢ Must have experience with North American taxes and companies

‚Ä¢ High proficiency in QuickBooks Online (QBO) ‚Äî critical

‚Ä¢ Strong proficiency in Excel and Google Sheets ‚Äî critical

‚Ä¢ Experience with Google Workspace (Gmail, Drive)

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with credit card and bill pay platforms such as Ramp and American Express (preferred)

‚Ä¢ Experience with NetSuite (preferred)



Experience Level:

‚Ä¢ Prior experience in bookkeeping, accounting support, or accounts payable

‚Ä¢ Experience supporting small to mid-sized businesses or growing brands is preferred



Qualifications & Skills:

‚Ä¢ Strong written communication skills with the ability to professionally communicate with vendors and internal stakeholders

‚Ä¢ High integrity and discretion when handling financial information

‚Ä¢ Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy

‚Ä¢ Highly organized and reliable, with the ability to manage recurring tasks independently

‚Ä¢ Comfortable working remotely with a distributed team



Preferred Industry Experience:

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with CPG, food and beverage brands, retailers, or DTC/eCommerce businesses

‚Ä¢ Experience working with Shopify and Amazon data or reporting is a plus



HOW TO APPLY:

‚Ä¢ Please include a link to your resume (not portfolio) along with your preferred wage per hour in USD.



Working Hours:

‚Ä¢ Monday - Friday, 7:00am - 11:00am PST (11:00pm - 3:00am Manila/PH)



Growth Opportunity:

‚Ä¢ The scope of this role may expand as Everyday Dose continues to grow

title: Affiliate Manager (Affiliate Recruitment + Management)
description:
**Location:** Remote 

**Employment Type:** Full-Time (Flexible Hours)

---



## **About Promofy**



**Entry-Level (Non-Managerial) | Experienced Operators Only | Clear SOPs**



Promofy is a performance-based word-of-mouth growth platform. Brands launch campaigns. Real people share products they genuinely like. Rewards are paid only for verified results.



No hype. No fake engagement. Just outcomes.



We‚Äôre building a global network of trusted Promoters‚Äîand we‚Äôre hiring experienced Affiliate Managers who can recruit, manage, and enforce quality from day one.



---



## **The Role**



As an **Affiliate Manager**, you are responsible for building and managing a high-quality network of Promoters on Promofy.



This is **not** a sales role and **not** a learning role.



It is a trust, quality, and operations role for candidates who already know how to:

* Recruit affiliates

* Evaluate performance

* Enforce rules

* Deliver results independently



You will operate within clear systems and authority.



---



## **What You‚Äôll Do**

* Recruit and source qualified Promoter candidates

* Review and approve Promoter applications

* Onboard Promoters and ensure rule compliance

* Monitor Promoter performance and behavior

* Investigate disputes using system logs and evidence

* Enforce platform policies (including suspensions and bans)

* Maintain clean internal records and reporting

* Deliver measurable promoter growth and quality



---



## **Who We‚Äôre Looking For**



This role is ideal if you are:

* Experienced in recruiting and managing affiliates

* Comfortable enforcing rules and making judgment calls

* Detail-oriented and process-driven

* Calm, professional, and fair in disputes

* Strong in written and verbal English

* Able to work independently with minimal oversight



**MUST Have (Non-Negotiable):**

* Hands-on experience recruiting affiliates or promoters

* Experience managing affiliate or creator programs

* Background in community moderation, compliance, trust & safety, or ops

* Proven ability to deliver results without training



Applicants without direct affiliate recruitment and management experience will not be considered.



---



## **Requirements**

* Reliable internet connection

* Quiet, professional home workspace

* Ability to manage time independently

* Willingness to follow strict operating guidelines

* Flexible availability (results matter more than fixed hours)



---



## **Compensation**

* BASE PAY: **USD $2,500 ‚Äì $3,500 per month** (based on experience and performance)

* BONUSES: Performance-based bonuses tied to promoter recruitment quality and outcomes

* Paid monthly



---



## **Why Work With Promofy**

* Fully remote

* Flexible hours

* Clear authority and SOPs

* Performance-driven culture

* Long-term growth opportunities

* Work on a platform built on trust‚Äînot ads



---



## **How to Apply (Required)**

To be considered, **all candidates must submit a short video** **(3‚Äì5 minutes) explaining:**

* Your past experience recruiting affiliates or promoters

* Exactly how you would recruit affiliates for Promofy starting on Day 1

* The channels, tactics, or systems you would use

* How many affiliates you realistically expect to recruit in your first 30 days



Applications **without an accessible video submission link (Loom/YouTube/Dropbox) will not be reviewed**.



Qualified candidates will be invited to the next stage of the review process.



---



Promofy is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate applicants based on experience, judgment, and results.

mbers

title: Full-Time Bookkeeper & Administrative Support
description:
About STRbkeep

STRbkeep is a bookkeeping practice built specifically for short-term rental (STR) property owners and small hospitality businesses. We currently manage the books for 45+ clients ‚Äî from individual property owners to multi-property LLCs ‚Äî and we‚Äôre growing.

We‚Äôre not just maintaining books. We‚Äôre actively building the systems, workflows, and standards that will define how this practice operates as it scales. That means our processes are evolving, we‚Äôre testing new technology, and we‚Äôre looking for someone who‚Äôs excited by that ‚Äî not intimidated by it.



The Role

This is not a heads-down, task-list-only position. Yes, there is real bookkeeping to do ‚Äî reconciliations, categorizing transactions, recording platform fees. But we are looking for someone who goes beyond executing tasks and actually thinks about the work.

Here is what that looks like in practice: You open a client‚Äôs QBO file for the first time. You look through the chart of accounts, the bank connections, how transactions have been categorized. You form an understanding of how things are set up ‚Äî and then you come to me with questions. Not just ‚ÄúWhat do I do?‚Äù but ‚ÄúI see it‚Äôs set up this way ‚Äî is that intentional? Here‚Äôs what I‚Äôd suggest.‚Äù

If you notice three clients have slightly different names for the same account, or that a bank rule could save 20 minutes a month, or that our work-tracking template is missing a column ‚Äî we want to hear it. You will have a direct line to the owner, and your input will shape how we build this practice.



Bookkeeping

‚Ä¢ Record bank and credit card activity in QuickBooks Online

‚Ä¢ Reconcile bank accounts and credit cards on a monthly basis

‚Ä¢ Categorize and reclassify transactions; review P&L reports for misclassified expenses

‚Ä¢ Split mortgage payments, Stripe payouts, and platform fees across appropriate accounts

‚Ä¢ Record STR platform fees (Airbnb, VRBO, etc.) in QBO

‚Ä¢ Assist with catch-up bookkeeping for clients who are behind on multiple months

‚Ä¢ Support year-end work including 1099 review and preparation

‚Ä¢ Reverse or correct entries left by prior bookkeepers



Administrative & Client Support

‚Ä¢ Follow up with clients to collect statements, documents, and access credentials

‚Ä¢ Help onboard new clients ‚Äî QBO setup, connecting bank feeds, initial data entry

‚Ä¢ Track task completion and flag items that need the owner‚Äôs review

‚Ä¢ Communicate with clients via
 (after introductions, using provided templates as a starting point)



Systems & Process Improvement

‚Ä¢ Review how each client‚Äôs QBO file is set up and ask questions to understand the reasoning

‚Ä¢ Identify inconsistencies across client files (chart of accounts naming, categorization patterns, bank rules) and suggest standardization

‚Ä¢ Recommend improvements to workflows, templates, and tracking tools based on what you see in the day-to-day work

‚Ä¢ Be open to testing new tools and technology as we evaluate what works best for STR bookkeeping

‚Ä¢ Help document processes and preferences so the practice can scale beyond one person‚Äôs memory



Who You Are

Curious and observant. You don‚Äôt just do what‚Äôs in front of you ‚Äî you notice patterns, ask why things are the way they are, and think about how they could be better. When you open a client‚Äôs file, you‚Äôre reading the setup, not just the task list.

Self-motivated. You can take a general direction and run with it. You don‚Äôt need to be checked on constantly, and you‚Äôre comfortable figuring things out before asking for help ‚Äî but you also know when to ask.

A clear communicator. You can articulate what you‚Äôre seeing in a client‚Äôs books, explain your reasoning, and frame suggestions in a way that‚Äôs easy to act on. You‚Äôre not afraid to say ‚ÄúThis doesn‚Äôt make sense to me‚Äù or ‚ÄúHere‚Äôs what I‚Äôd change.‚Äù

Comfortable with ‚Äúin progress.‚Äù Our systems are being built right now. If you need a perfectly documented SOP before you can start, this isn‚Äôt the right fit. If you‚Äôre energized by helping create those SOPs, it is.

Detail-oriented but practical. Accuracy matters. But so does knowing when something is good enough to move forward and when it needs to be perfect.



Requirements

‚Ä¢ QuickBooks Online proficiency ‚Äî you should be able to navigate QBO confidently, not just follow step-by-step instructions. You understand how the chart of accounts, bank feeds, reconciliations, and reports work together.

‚Ä¢ Bank reconciliation experience ‚Äî this is a core part of the role across dozens of client accounts each month.

‚Ä¢ Excel proficiency ‚Äî comfortable with sorting, filtering, basic formulas, and working with exported data.

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with Relay or similar banking platforms ‚Äî experience connecting and managing bank feeds.

‚Ä¢ Reliable and responsive communication ‚Äî you respond promptly, flag issues early, and keep the owner informed without being asked.

‚Ä¢ Willingness to work US business hours (CST) ‚Äî or have significant overlap with US daytime hours.



Nice to Have

‚Ä¢ Experience with short-term rental or hospitality bookkeeping

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with STR platforms (Airbnb, VRBO, Hospitable) and how their payouts and fees flow into accounting

‚Ä¢ Experience with 1099 preparation and year-end accounting

‚Ä¢ Interest in or experience with workflow tools, automation, or process documentation

‚Ä¢ Prior experience in a small or growing bookkeeping practice where you wore multiple hats



What to Expect

This is a full-time engagement (approximately 40 hours/week), with workload varying based on client needs ‚Äî month-end and year-end are busier. You will work directly with the owner, Cheyenne. Early on, expect a collaborative onboarding period where you will walk through client files together, discuss how things are set up and why, and establish shared expectations. Over time, the goal is for you to work more independently while continuing to surface questions and ideas.

Client communication will be guided at first. Cheyenne will introduce you and provide templates. But we are looking for someone who can eventually own those conversations professionally and confidently.

We are also actively evaluating new tools and technology. If you are someone who likes trying new things and has opinions about what works, you will have a voice in those decisions.



APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS (REQUIRED)

To be considered for this role, you must submit both of the following:

1. Your resume

2. A 2‚Äì3 minute video introduction explaining:

‚Äì Your bookkeeping and QuickBooks Online experience

‚Äì Why you believe you are a strong fit for this role

‚Äì How you approach organization, communication, and process improvement

Please begin your video by addressing Cheyenne by name, as attention to detail is an important part of our hiring process.

Applications without a video will not be reviewed.



We are not looking for a polished production ‚Äî a simple recording from your phone or laptop is perfectly fine. What we care about is how you communicate, how you think, and whether you took the time to read this posting carefully.

title: Content Researcher
description:
Story Hunter - Blackfiles (3D Documentary Channel) | Remote, Flexible, Performance-Based



ABOUT US

Blackfiles is a 300K+ subscriber YouTube channel that produces cinematic 3D animated stories about remarkable individuals who took on powerful systems, hackers who outsmarted the FBI, con artists who robbed banks with genius schemes, ordinary people who brought down cartels. We publish 3 videos per week and are growing fast.

We're looking for Story Hunters, obsessive researchers who can find the stories nobody else has covered and pitch them in a way that makes us say "we NEED to make this video".



WHAT IS A BLACKFILES STORY?

Before you apply, you need to understand what we do. Watch at least 3 of these videos:

 - The Man Who Outsmarted EVERY Agency (John McAfee) ‚Äî 1.9M views

 - The Most Genius Bank Heist EVER (Banco R√≠o) ‚Äî 1.75M views

 - The Prodigy Who Escaped North Korea ‚Äî 1.17M views

 - The Man Who Outsmarted EVERY Government (Pavel Durov) ‚Äî 1.21M views

 - The Man Who Found the Infinite Cash Hack ‚Äî 1.28M views



What do these stories have in common?

 1. One named protagonist, not a group, not "hackers," one specific person whose story we follow from beginning to end

 2. A powerful antagonist, the FBI, CIA, NSA, a cartel, a government, a financial system. Something the audience instantly recognizes as powerful

 3. An "impossible" feat, the protagonist did something that sounds too crazy to be real

 4. A complete narrative arc, setup, escalation, crisis, resolution. These are documentaries, not news reports

 5. Cross-market appeal, you don't need to be a hacker to find these stories fascinating. Anyone can connect to them



What does NOT work on Blackfiles:

 - Stories about groups or unnamed collectives ("The Hackers Who...")

 - Generic cybersecurity explainers without a human drama at the center

 - Stories without an ending (still ongoing, unresolved)

 - Stories already covered by 10+ YouTube channels

 - Cryptocurrency hacks (our audience doesn't connect to digital currency theft)

 - Stories framed from law enforcement's perspective ("How the FBI Caught...")



WHAT YOU'LL DO

Find real stories that fit the Blackfiles formula, research them thoroughly, and submit structured story briefs. You are NOT writing scripts, you're finding the raw material and making the case for why each story will captivate our audience.

Your deliverable is a story brief, a structured pitch that includes the proposed title, a summary, protagonist details, the hook, sources, and your reasoning for why it works. We provide a detailed template.



WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

 - Someone who naturally falls down Wikipedia rabbit holes and reads longform journalism for fun

 - Broad knowledge of cybercrime, heists, espionage, con artists, whistleblowers, or similar "dark" true stories

 - The ability to evaluate WHY a story would work as a YouTube video, not just that it's interesting

 - Strong written communication ‚Äî your pitch needs to sell the story in under 200 words



HOW IT WORKS

 1. We'll share our Story Selection Guide so you understand exactly what works on our channel and what doesn't

 2. You submit story briefs using our structured template (title, summary, protagonist, hook, sources)

 3. We review and respond to every submission within 12 hours

 4. Approved stories enter our production pipeline



COMPENSATION

This is performance-based. The better your stories, the more you earn:

 ? Story approved for production = $60

 ???? Your proposed title is used = +$10 bonus

 ???? Video hits 300K views in 15 days = +$50 bonus

 ???? Video hits 500K views in 15 days = +$100 bonus

 ???? Video hits 1M views in 15 days = +$200 bonus



What does this look like in practice? A researcher consistently delivering 8-10 approved stories per month earns $480-600+ base, plus view bonuses. Our average Blackfiles video gets 300K+ views, so bonuses are realistic, not theoretical.

Top performers who prove themselves over 2-3 months will be offered a monthly retainer with guaranteed base pay + bonuses on top. We don't pay for stories that don't fit our channel, but we ALWAYS give feedback on why a pitch was rejected so you improve over time.



TO APPLY

Complete our application form: 

You'll need to submit 3 story pitches using our format. This is your audition, show us you understand what Blackfiles needs. Budget 1-2 hours for a quality application.

Payment: PayPal, crypto, bank transfer, Wise, or similar.

Location: Fully remote, any timezone.

Questions?
 us at

title: Motion Designer & Video Editor
description:
Looking for Motion Designer & Video Editor



We are looking for a creative, reliable motion designer to help with:



- Animation + video support for brand case studies

title: B2B Appointment Setter ‚Äì AI Solution (US Market)
description:
About Us



We are Valemont Partners, a company selling a 24/7 AI receptionist solution in the United States.



Our AI system:

 ‚Ä¢ Answers inbound calls 24/7

 ‚Ä¢ Handles customer inquiries

 ‚Ä¢ Follows up with leads automatically

 ‚Ä¢ Books appointments directly into clients‚Äô calendars



We help call-heavy businesses stop missing revenue opportunities.



?



Who We‚Äôre Looking For



We are hiring a serious, performance-driven B2B appointment setter to book qualified discovery calls with business owners in the US.



You will have freedom to choose the niche you believe you can perform best in ‚Äî as long as the business depends heavily on inbound calls.



From experience, we prefer avoiding highly price-sensitive sectors such as:

 ‚Ä¢ Restaurants

 ‚Ä¢ Barbers



We‚Äôve seen stronger results in niches like:

 ‚Ä¢ Plumbers

 ‚Ä¢ Car dealerships

 ‚Ä¢ Auto repair shops

 ‚Ä¢ Towing companies

 ‚Ä¢ Medical / aesthetic clinics

 ‚Ä¢ Cleaning services



?



Important: Lead Sourcing



We do NOT provide leads.



You will be responsible for:

 ‚Ä¢ Sourcing your own leads

 ‚Ä¢ Identifying decision-makers

 ‚Ä¢ Booking qualified discovery calls

 ‚Ä¢ Ensuring strong show-up rates



Booking calls alone is not enough.



We prioritize:

 ‚Ä¢ Decision-makers only

 ‚Ä¢ Strong ICP fit

 ‚Ä¢ High show-up rates



You must implement proper follow-up systems (reminders, confirmations, reschedules if needed) to ensure prospects attend the call.



Quality and attendance matter more than raw volume.:



?



Structure & Compensation



We are open to both part-time and full-time roles, depending on performance and alignment.



Before moving into a longer-term agreement, we will run a 1-week paid trial period.



This trial is not unpaid. It is a compensated test week, based on the rate and structure we agree on beforehand. The purpose of the trial is to evaluate:

 ‚Ä¢ Lead quality

 ‚Ä¢ Booking volume

 ‚Ä¢ Show-up rate

 ‚Ä¢ Communication and follow-up process

 ‚Ä¢ Overall fit and professionalism



If performance meets expectations, we will move forward into a longer-term part-time or full-time arrangement.



Compensation structure will be discussed individually with shortlisted candidates based on experience, availability, and performance expectations..



?



To Apply, Please Answer the Following:

 1. If we ran a 1-week paid trial, how many qualified discovery calls can you realistically book?

 2. Out of those, how many do you expect would show up?

 3. Which niche(s) would you focus on and why?

 4. What channels would you primarily use (cold calling, LinkedIn,
, etc.)?

 5. Please send a short 2‚Äì3 minute audio explaining your background, your results or how you would approach this project specifically.

title: Technical Project Manager. Software Development
description:
Overview

This role manages end-to-end delivery of software projects. The Technical Project Manager guides technical planning, coordinates engineering activities, enforces SDLC best practices, and ensures that product requirements translate into clear development tasks. The role requires strong technical literacy, the ability to navigate engineering constraints, and disciplined project execution.



Core Responsibilities

‚Ä¢ Lead planning, task scoping, prioritization, and scheduling for software development initiatives.

‚Ä¢ Translate product requirements into actionable technical specifications and structured backlogs.

‚Ä¢ Coordinate with backend, frontend, QA, DevOps, and architecture teams to ensure alignment.

‚Ä¢ Maintain project visibility through roadmaps, sprint plans, and tracking dashboards.

‚Ä¢ Run agile ceremonies including sprint planning, standups, grooming sessions, and retrospectives.

‚Ä¢ Identify technical risks, architectural dependencies, and resource gaps. Implement mitigation plans.

‚Ä¢ Ensure documentation is maintained across requirements, architecture, and release notes.

‚Ä¢ Oversee quality gates including code reviews, testing workflows, and release readiness.

‚Ä¢ Manage communication between engineering teams, leadership, and non-technical stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ Support release management. Coordinate deployments and post-release follow-up.



Required Qualifications

‚Ä¢ Proven experience managing software development projects in an agile environment.

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of backend and frontend development concepts, APIs, microservices, and data flows.

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with SDLC, version control workflows, testing processes, and CI/CD pipelines.

‚Ä¢ Ability to translate technical concepts into clear plans and stakeholder updates.

‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with project tools including Jira, Linear, GitHub, or similar systems.

‚Ä¢ Strong analytical and documentation skills.

‚Ä¢ Ability to manage timelines, shifting priorities, and distributed engineering teams.



Preferred Experience

‚Ä¢ Background as a software engineer, QA engineer, or technical analyst.

‚Ä¢ Understanding of cloud infrastructure, containerization, and scaling considerations.

‚Ä¢ Experience coordinating automation or integration-heavy projects.

‚Ä¢ Exposure to DevOps practices and deployment processes.

‚Ä¢ Ability to review technical proposals or perform light technical validation.



Candidate Profile

This individual operates at the intersection of engineering discipline and project structure. They understand how software is built. They can recognize technical dependencies early. They ensure engineers have clarity. They maintain 
ntum across projects while safeguarding quality and reliability.

title: Software Engineer
description:

The engineer will design scalable workflows, build application logic, develop custom integration components, and ensure seamless communication between internal and external systems. n8n is a core tool in the stack, but the position spans backend development, API engineering, and data layer design.

‚Ä¢ Ensure performance, scalability, and reliability across workflows and supporting services.

‚Ä¢ Deliver technical documentation covering architecture, integration patterns, and code design.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with product, engineering, and operations teams to translate requirements into end-to-end software solutions.

‚Ä¢ Experience with database schema design, optimization, and administration.

‚Ä¢ Solid understanding of REST/JSON APIs, webhooks, authentication, and integration architecture.

‚Ä¢ Ability to design maintainable, scalable, secure systems across both application and automation layers.

‚Ä¢ Strong debugging and problem-solving skills in distributed environments.

‚Ä¢ Comfort working independently in a fast-moving startup context.



Preferred Experience

‚Ä¢ Background with automation platforms such as Zapier, Make, or Integromat.

Candidate Profile

A full-stack engineer who thinks in terms of systems and data flow. Skilled at bridging application logic with workflow automation. Capable of converting ambiguous operational challenges into cohesive, scalable software solutions.



What This Role Offers

‚Ä¢ A collaborative engineering culture focused on solving complex technical problems.

‚Ä¢ Competitive compensation aligned with engineering depth and automation expertise.

title: Social Media Video Editor for Engaging Reels
description:
Expert Social Media Video Editor for Engaging Short-Form Content (Reels, TikToks)



Company Overview

We are a growing brand looking to expand our social media presence through compelling and high-energy video content. We are seeking a creative and skilled video editor to partner with us in creating engaging reels that capture attention, tell our story, and drive audience growth. If you are passionate about social media trends and have a knack for creating viral-worthy content, we want to hear from you!



Job Description

We are looking for a talented and experienced Video Editor to join our team on a project basis. The ideal candidate will be responsible for editing raw video footage into polished, engaging, and on-brand social media reels (Instagram Reels and TikTok). You will be working with a variety of footage to create short-form videos that are fast-paced, visually appealing, and optimized for maximum engagement.



This is a remote, freelance position with compensation on a per-video basis.



Key Responsibilities

‚Ä¢ Edit raw video footage into engaging 15-90 second social media videos.

‚Ä¢ Incorporate graphics, text overlays, split screens, and other dynamic elements to enhance storytelling.

‚Ä¢ Apply modern video editing techniques and stay up-to-date with the latest social media trends.

‚Ä¢ Ensure all videos align with our brand identity, style, and tone.

‚Ä¢ Add captions, music, and sound effects to create a complete and immersive viewing experience.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with our team to understand project goals and deliver content that meets our objectives.

‚Ä¢ Manage and organize video files and project assets.



What We're Looking For: The Principles of Engagement

We are looking for an editor who understands the science behind engaging social media video. Your editing style should reflect the following principles:

‚Ä¢ Rapid Pacing: You understand that attention spans are short. Your edits will feature quick cuts, with a new visual element or change of pace every 1-3 seconds to maintain viewer momentum.

‚Ä¢ Strong Hooks: You know how to grab attention within the first 3 seconds of a video with a compelling visual, a bold statement, or an intriguing question.

‚Ä¢ Dynamic Visuals: You are proficient in using a variety of techniques to keep the viewer engaged, including:

‚Ä¢ Lists and Graphics: Using on-screen text and graphics to present information in a clear and visually appealing way.

‚Ä¢ Split Screens: Effectively using split screens for comparisons, reactions, or multi-angle storytelling.

‚Ä¢ Motion and Zoom: Using subtle zooms, pans, and motion graphics to guide the viewer's focus.

‚Ä¢ Narrative Flow: You can structure a video with a clear beginning (setup), middle (payoff), and end (reward), even in a short format.

‚Ä¢ Trend Integration: You are constantly aware of the latest trends on Instagram Reels and TikTok and can creatively incorporate them into our content.



Required Skills and Qualifications

‚Ä¢ Proven experience as a video editor, with a strong portfolio of social media videos (Reels, TikToks).

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in professional video editing software (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, DaVinci Resolve, CapCut).

‚Ä¢ A keen eye for detail and a strong understanding of visual storytelling, pacing, and rhythm.

‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently, manage your time effectively, and meet deadlines.

‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills and a collaborative spirit.

‚Ä¢ A deep understanding of the social media landscape and what makes content go viral.



Compensation



We offer a competitive rate of $5 - $15 USD per completed video, depending on the complexity and length of the project. We are looking for a long-term partnership with the right candidate.



How to Apply



We have a two-step application process designed to find the best fit for our team.



Step 1: Initial Application



Please submit the following:



1.

Your resume or a summary of your experience.



2.

A link to your portfolio or a collection of your best work. Please highlight 2-3 examples of social media reels that you are most proud of and explain why.



Step 2: Paid Test Project



Shortlisted candidates will be invited to complete a paid test project. We will provide you with a small package of raw footage and a creative brief. This will allow us to see your skills in action and how you interpret our brand. You will be compensated for this test project, regardless of the outcome.



We are excited to see your work and potentially welcome you to our team!

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Please take the time to read this, as applying on OnlineJobs is just the start of your interview process. We will ask you to submit your application on our Careers page and complete ALL assessments before we consider you for the position.  This is a full time permanent position.



Apply Here : https://careers.firstdirectmarketing.com/jobs/Careers/669032000005934350/Executive-Assistant?source=CareerSite



First Direct is looking for an Virtual Executive Assistant to the President.



The Executive Assistant directly supports the President through a variety of administrative duties, client projects, and multi-department teams. These responsibilities include managing the executive‚Äôs calendars, taking notes at meetings for action items, directly responding to clients (within prescribed limits) on behalf of the executive, designing materials and presentations for meetings, storing digital files in appropriate locations, and more. He/she will attend the executive‚Äôs meetings, record and publish polished notes, communicate meeting action items with appropriate parties, and track action items to ensure completion.



The position is a direct extension of the executive and carries immense responsibility to represent each executive with poise, professionalism, and a friendly disposition at all times. To succeed in this role, the Executive Assistant should have excellent time management and remarkable communication skills (written and verbal), as they‚Äôll collaborate with various internal teams to deliver exceptional results on extremely tight deadlines. He/she takes responsibility for the executive's relationships with clients, fostering genuine relationships and inspiring trust in the organization through texts, phone calls, emails, meetings, private coaching sessions, and interactions at events. 



The Executive Assistant is highly independent. He/she possesses a sharp attention to detail, an exceptional aptitude for overcoming roadblocks and finding solutions, and the ability to prioritize his/her workload in a fast-paced and ambiguous environment. The Executive Assistant eagerly seeks answers, is not afraid to teach himself/herself new skills, and manages projects with minimal guidance. 





About The Company



First Direct is a fast-growing marketing agency in Bellevue, Nebraska. We help companies worldwide to find the right marketing solutions to empower their growth and success. We value ethical marketing practices and building solutions that solve real problems for businesses. We want companies to Take Back Their Marketing!



We invest in our employee's personal growth. Daily sales and development training through Cardone University helps employees reach their Personal, Professional and Financial Goals!



We want people on our team who want to work in a professional environment where they can excel at their job and pursue their personal passions and goals!



We operate with six core values, both internally and with our clients. They are Discipline, Inspirational, Accountability, Transparency, Alignment, and Results.



Requirements

Stable Internet Connection

Stable Computer and Setup

Ability to work 8AM to 5Pm Central Standard Time (9PM to 6AM PHP Time)





Performance Objectives :

? Ensure all administrative responsibilities (as detailed above) are fully executed with the utmost attention to detail, efficiency, and within deadlines. 

? Represent the executives and First Direct with a high level of professionalism, friendliness, maturity, and customer service in every interaction (internal and external), fostering genuine relationships and inspiring trust in the organization.

? Guard each executives‚Äô time and access as a gatekeeper, determining which meeting requests to approve or deny‚Äîin alignment with the executives‚Äô priorities and the organization‚Äôs goals. 

? Liaison between all departments and at all levels within the organization, tracking any outstanding action items to completion and confidently moving projects forward. 

? Display superior cross-functional collaboration skills: analytical mindset, resourcefulness, team orientation, clear communication. 

? Leverage Microsoft365, Google Workspace, and GoHighLevel, and other technology to accomplish tasks, with a strong willingness to learn new software and workflows if needed. 

? Complete duties independently and prioritize his/her workload, in alignment with the organization‚Äôs mission, vision, and goals. 

? Follow applicable processes and procedures as well as write and maintain processes for their own responsibilities. 

? Inform the administrative team lead and executives of any foreseen roadblocks or delays. 

? Exhibit a ‚Äúcan-do,‚Äù positive attitude at all times.





Key Competencies : 

? Proven experience in storing and retrieving digital files, maintaining databases, managing multiple calendars, scheduling travel, monitoring multiple email inboxes, recording notes, and designing meeting materials. 

? Excellence in organization, planning, problem solving, and effective management of resources.

? Superior communication skills, both written and verbal. Include the ability to draft responses on behalf of the executives with all attempts made to retain the executive‚Äôs voice and tone. 

? Aptitude for building relationships with professionals at all levels of the organization and with clients, both in-person and remotely.

? Ability to collaborate with other team members while working under pressure and while considering the perspectives of multiple personalities. 

? Resolve any issues or problems presented by clients or staff, to include addressing complaints and designing solutions with the utmost professionalism and a desire for win-win outcomes.  

? Ability to look at things from different angles and ask questions to seek a better understanding.

? Desire for continuous improvement and eagerness for learning new skills (often self-taught)

? Swift adaptability to changes in process and priorities. 

? Self-starter who is  working independently and with minimal supervision.

? Experience juggling multiple projects and recurring duties simultaneously, ensuring efficient completion within deadlines and sharp attention to detail. 

? Ability to maintain poise, professionalism, and positivity at all times.

Willingness and ability to work extended hours or weekends as needed to support the occasional local client events or special projects. 

? The ideal candidate will possess a willingness to respond to texts, emails, and calls from executives, staff, and clients outside of standard office hours. 



Highly proficient with computers, Mac, Google G Suite, GoHighLevel, Looker Studio and various marketing related technologies



Benefits

- 13TH MONTH

- KEY PERFORMANCE BONUS (AFTER 90 DAYS OF EMPLOYMENT)

- FOREX FEES

title: Full-Stack Developers (Front-End and Back-End)
description:
Apply here: 

Website: IDEA VENTURE STUDIO

Location: Remote

Status: Project-based with potential transition to full-time



Job Description



We are seeking highly capable Full-Stack Developers (Front-End and Back-End) to build and scale a modern Claims Payment App for PetCoverage.ai ‚Äî an AI-powered pet insurance platform.



This role goes beyond standard web development. You will help architect, build, and optimize a secure, scalable claims processing and payment system that integrates dynamic data flows, user dashboards, payment processing logic, and backend automation.



You will work across a modern stack including Next.js, GitHub, Replit, Cursor AI, AWS, Contentful, and Algolia, using AI tools to accelerate debugging, architecture planning, and development workflows.



We are looking for developers who can independently ship secure, production-ready features in an agile and fast-paced environment.



Key Responsibilities

- Front-End Development

- Build and optimize responsive UI using Next.js / React

- Develop user dashboards for claims submission, tracking, and payment status

- Implement dynamic forms, document uploads, and status notifications

- Ensure smooth UX, fast loading speeds, and mobile responsiveness

- Integrate search and filtering using Algolia



Back-End Development

- Architect and build backend services on AWS (Lambda, S3, API Gateway)

- Develop claims processing workflows and payment logic

- Integrate third-party APIs (insurance data, payment gateways, verification systems)

- Manage structured data flows and simulated insurance claims logic

-Ensure security, authentication, and data protection best practices

- Optimize database performance and serverless functions



AI-Enabled Workflow

- Use AI tools (Cursor AI, Replit Ghostwriter, ChatGPT/Claude) for:

- Debugging and refactoring

- Test generation

- Architecture planning

- Documentation

- Performance optimization



DevOps & Collaboration

-Deploy and monitor applications via Vercel

- Maintain clean GitHub workflows (branches, PRs, code reviews)

- Collaborate asynchronously with stakeholders to align releases with business objectives

- Continuously improve performance, scalability, and reliability



Qualifications

- 2+ years of experience in Next.js, React, Node.js, or modern JS frameworks

- Strong experience building data-driven applications

- Experience with AWS serverless architecture

- Solid understanding of GitHub workflows

- Experience integrating APIs and payment systems

- Familiarity with Contentful and Algolia is a plus

- Strong debugging, optimization, and system architecture skills

- Comfortable leveraging AI tools to accelerate development

- Strong written communication skills for async collaboration

title: Ecommerce Growth Marketing Manager | Full Stack
description:
Remote | Working Hours: 9am to 6pm Eastern Time with required overlap. Flexible hours. We care about results, not clock watching. Salary based on experience, grows with performance + bonus structures.



About TopFoxx



TopFoxx is a women owned ecommerce eyewear brand creating fashion forward designs with real functionality. Our slogan is ‚Äúsunglasses with a solution.‚Äù From floating sunglasses to tangle free aviators and foldable pocket sized designs, we build innovative products for modern women who want style with purpose. We are a lean, fast moving startup with strong revenue, bold branding, and a culture built on ownership, accountability, and performance. We do not hire often for roles like this. This is a rare opportunity to step into a high impact growth position inside a scaling brand, fully remote.

We value initiative, personal responsibility, and people who genuinely care about the quality of their work. Our team is supportive, direct, and collaborative. We communicate openly, help each other solve problems, and move quickly. At the same time, we hold a high standard. Mistakes can happen, but careless errors and repeated oversight are not acceptable. We expect people to double check their work, think critically, and take pride in execution. If you thrive in an environment where performance matters and growth is constant, you will do well here.



Role Overview



We are looking for a Full Stack Growth Marketing Manager who is entrepreneurial and can strategize and execute like a growth hacker, lead and operate like a director, analyze performance like a scientist, and move with the urgency and ownership of a founder. This is a high impact role for someone who wants real responsibility inside a scaling ecommerce brand.

The majority of your focus will be paid media,
 marketing, SMS, and lifecycle marketing. You will strategize and execute across Meta, TikTok ads, TikTok Shop,
 and SMS campaigns, copywriting, A B testing, segmentation, and performance optimization, with the goal of increasing revenue and profitability across these core channels.

You will work directly under the Marketing Director as their right hand in growth execution, collaborating closely with the Founder. You are responsible for identifying bottlenecks, improving performance across channels, and ensuring that every marketing initiative ties back to measurable revenue impact.

Beyond core channels, you will support and optimize additional revenue streams including Amazon, influencer marketing, affiliate marketing, and emerging platforms as needed. You will identify funnel weaknesses, UX and UI improvements, conversion issues, and growth opportunities across the business, including landing pages, product pages, upsells, offers, and drop off points. If something affects revenue, you investigate it. If something breaks, you fix it. If there is a gap, you close it.

This is a lean startup environment. Growth challenges do not stay inside strict job descriptions. As needed, you are expected to step in, solve problems independently, and take full ownership of outcomes. We will lean into your strongest channel where you can drive the most impact, but you must be comfortable operating across the full ecommerce growth ecosystem and contributing ideas that improve performance across departments.



Key Responsibilities



1. Paid Media and Performance Marketing

 ‚Ä¢ Oversee and support daily performance across TikTok, Meta, Google, Amazon, and other paid channels as needed

 ‚Ä¢ Identify scaling opportunities and underperformance quickly and take action

 ‚Ä¢ Interpret CAC, ROAS, MER, LTV, AOV, and blended performance metrics

 ‚Ä¢ Evaluate creative performance and guide improvements that increase profitability

 ‚Ä¢ Compare attribution across Shopify, ad platforms, and UTMs to find the most accurate signal

 ‚Ä¢ Work toward managing campaigns directly when needed

 ‚Ä¢ Collaborate with video editors and creative teams to develop high converting ad concepts

You must understand how paid acquisition connects to contribution margin and overall business profitability.



2.
 and SMS Lifecycle Marketing and Deliverability

 ‚Ä¢ Own Klaviyo strategy and execution for campaigns and automated flows

 ‚Ä¢ Write or direct strong, conversion focused copy

 ‚Ä¢ Improve segmentation, personalization, and customer journeys

 ‚Ä¢ Optimize for deliverability and placement in the primary inbox, not promotions

 ‚Ä¢ Increase revenue per subscriber and customer lifetime value

 ‚Ä¢ Continuously test subject lines, offers, timing, and upsells

You must understand customer psychology and how to drive revenue through lifecycle marketing.



3. Conversion Rate Optimization and Funnel Improvement

 ‚Ä¢ Improve the full customer journey from click to checkout

 ‚Ä¢ Analyze landing pages, product pages, and checkout flow

 ‚Ä¢ Identify friction points, drop off areas, and UX and UI issues

 ‚Ä¢ Test bundles, upsells, cross sells, and offers

 ‚Ä¢ Implement improvements inside Shopify and related tools

 ‚Ä¢ Troubleshoot technical marketing issues that affect conversion

If there is a growth bottleneck, you find it and fix it.



4. Data, KPIs, and Reporting

 ‚Ä¢ Drive decisions through accurate and actionable data

 ‚Ä¢ Set clear leading and lagging KPIs tied to revenue and efficiency

 ‚Ä¢ Produce weekly performance reports with insights and action steps

 ‚Ä¢ Pull and reconcile data from Shopify, ad platforms, Klaviyo, and analytics tools

 ‚Ä¢ Identify inconsistencies across platforms and determine the most reliable source of truth

 ‚Ä¢ Recommend and implement strategic pivots based on performance

You must be comfortable working inside dashboards daily and extracting signal from noise.



5.Growth Testing and Revenue Expansion

 ‚Ä¢ Research competitors, trends, and new growth opportunities

 ‚Ä¢ Propose and execute structured growth experiments

 ‚Ä¢ Test new offers, creatives, funnels, and revenue channels

 ‚Ä¢ Support and optimize additional revenue streams including TikTok Shop, Amazon, influencer marketing, and affiliate marketing

 ‚Ä¢ Continuously look for ways to expand revenue and improve efficiency

This role requires a growth mindset, disciplined execution, and full ownership of outcomes.



What We Are Looking For

‚Ä¢  3 to 5 years of experience in ecommerce or DTC brands is strongly preferred

 ‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of performance marketing and lifecycle marketing

 ‚Ä¢  Experience with Shopify and Klaviyo preferred

 ‚Ä¢ High analytical ability and comfort working with data

 ‚Ä¢ Strong written communication skills

 ‚Ä¢ Ability to operate independently without constant supervision

 ‚Ä¢ Comfort working in a fast paced startup environment

 ‚Ä¢ High personal responsibility and ownership mindset

If you do not know something, you learn it quickly. Skills can be developed. Mindset cannot.



Compensation and Growth

This is a remote international role. Compensation is based on level of experience and past proven performance.

There is clear upside for strong performers. As you drive more revenue and impact, your compensation will grow. This is a long term opportunity for someone who wants to become a key growth driver inside a scaling ecommerce brand.

TopFoxx is for high performer A players only. If you are looking for a simple task based job, this is not it. If you are ready to grow fast, take ownership, and tie your performance directly to business results, this role offers real opportunity.

title: Project Architect (Design-Focused)
description:
About the Role 



We are seeking a licensed Architect to join our team as a Project Architect, with a strong design background and a high level of skill in architectural illustration and visual communication. 



This role is suited to an architect who leads projects through design thinking, concept development, and design coordination, and who can clearly communicate ideas through high-quality sketches, diagrams, and presentation drawings. Strong illustration skills are valued as a design communication tool, complementing the role‚Äôs broader responsibility for architectural design and project delivery. 



You will work on Australian development projects, collaborating closely with developers, town planners, and internal design teams. The role requires both strong architectural judgment and the ability to translate design intent into clear, compelling visuals that support planning approvals and client decisions.  



Qualifications 



-Licensed Architect (Board or Professional License Exam passer) 

-Minimum 2 years of experience in architectural design practice 

-Strong background in concept design and design development 

-High-level architectural illustration, 3D renders and visual presentation skills 

-Experience working with Australian developers, builders, or consultants is an advantage 

-Solid understanding of technical documentation and planning requirements 

-Proficient in AutoCAD, SketchUp, Lumion, Photoshop, and related architectural software 

-Strong design problem-solving ability and creative judgment 

-Clear and professional communication skills for coordination with clients, planners, and internal teams 

-Collaborative, reliable, and proactive approach to project delivery 



Must Have 

-Computer or laptop with at least 16GB RAM 

-Noise-cancelling headphones 

-Licensed or working versions of required software (AutoCAD, SketchUp, Lumion, Photoshop, etc.) 

-Stable internet connection, minimum 60 Mbps upload and download 



Must Submit 

-Board Exam Certificate 

-Professional references from previous employers with contact details 

-Portfolio demonstrating architectural design work, including concept design, illustrations, high-level 3D renders and presentation drawings 



  Key Responsibilities 



-Lead and contribute to architectural concept design and design development 

-Produce architectural illustrations, high-level 3D renders, sketches, diagrams, and presentation drawings that clearly communicate design intent 

-Prepare drawings and documentation for development approvals using CAD or Revit, and 3D software 

-Develop high-quality presentation materials for clients and planning submissions 

-Coordinate with Australian town planners to ensure compliance with planning and technical requirements 

-Translate design concepts into clear, buildable architectural outcomes 

-Support project delivery from concept through to design development 

-Work collaboratively with internal teams to maintain design quality and consistency 



Interested applicants can send CV + Portfolio to

title: Senior Accounting Staff
description:
Job description

Position Summary:



¬∑        The Senior Accounting Staff will play a key role in overseeing and managing the financial activities of the organization. This position requires a strategic thinker with strong analytical skills and a deep understanding of financial principles. The Senior Accounting Staff will collaborate with various departments to ensure accurate financial reporting, budgeting, and compliance with relevant regulations.



 Responsibilities: 



¬∑        The Senior Accounting Staff is?responsible?to?carry?out?accounting and finance department duties as follows:



 Payment Processing: Process and execute authorized payment/purchase requests, reimbursement and liquidations thru electronic payment means in compliance with internal controls and protocols.



 Cash Transactions: Verify the completeness and accuracy of all incoming and outgoing cash transactions against the General Ledger (GL) to ensure correct recording and classification.



 Daily Cash Position Report: Prepare and distribute the consolidated daily cash position report, accurately tracking balances across all corporate bank accounts.



 Daily Journal Entries: Monitor the recording of daily transactions (sales, purchases, expenses, etc.) and ensure the entries are correct and use appropriate accounts.



 Bank Reconciliation: Perform complex bank reconciliations for all accounts daily and monthly, identifying and resolving all discrepancies, unidentified credits, and unexplained variances promptly.



Accounts Receivable Management: Manage outstanding accounts receivable and sales invoices, monitor collection status, and confirm payments.



 Invoice Issuance: Monitor the issuance of sales invoices to clients for sales or services, and ensure payment is made within the due date. Ensure that all details are correct and amounts are properly accounted for.



Monthly Account Analysis: Prepare management reports and variance reports for review of the Accounting Manager and for submission/report to Management.



Assist the Accounting Manager in the preparation of Income Statement, Balance Sheet and Cash Flow Reports. Provide justifications for variances and unusual increases or decreases on accounts.



 Annual Closing: Assist the Accounting Manager in the closing of books and transactions for the entire year, prepare final financial statements (income statement, balance sheet, cash flow statement, etc.), and prepare documents for external audits and submission to tax authorities.



Requirements:



¬∑        Bachelor's degree in accounting.



¬∑        More than 3 years of experience in accounting and/or finance roles



¬∑        Sound knowledge of accounting principles, practices, standards, laws and regulations.



¬∑        Strong attention to detail and accuracy.



¬∑        Excellent organizational and time management skills.



¬∑        Strong communication & interpersonal skills.



¬∑        Proactive & Responsible







Job summary

A Senior Accountaning Staff is responsible for performing complex accounting needs for their employer.

title: Blueprint Drafter - AutoCAD/Chief Architect Specialist
description:
Position Overview



We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Blueprint Drafter with expertise in AutoCAD and Chief Architect software to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for creating accurate, detailed technical drawings and blueprints for residential and commercial construction projects. This role requires a strong understanding of architectural design principles, building codes, and construction documentation standards.



Job Title

Blueprint Drafter - AutoCAD/Chief Architect Specialist



Job Summary



The Blueprint Drafter will work closely with architects, engineers, and project managers to transform design concepts into comprehensive construction documents. You will be responsible for creating floor plans, elevations, sections, and detailed construction drawings using industry-standard CAD software. This position demands precision, creativity, and the ability to interpret complex technical specifications while maintaining adherence to building codes and project requirements.



Key Responsibilities



Drafting and Design Creation

‚Ä¢ Create detailed architectural drawings, blueprints, and construction documents using AutoCAD and Chief Architect software

‚Ä¢ Develop floor plans, roof plans, foundation plans, elevations, sections, and detail drawings

‚Ä¢ Produce accurate dimensioning, annotations, and specifications for construction projects

‚Ä¢ Convert sketches and design concepts into professional technical drawings

‚Ä¢ Create 3D models and renderings to support design visualization and client presentations



Project Coordination

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with architects, structural engineers, mechanical engineers, and other project stakeholders

‚Ä¢ Review and incorporate redline markups and revision requests into drawings

‚Ä¢ Maintain version control and manage drawing sets throughout project lifecycles

‚Ä¢ Coordinate drawing standards and ensure consistency across multiple drawing sets

‚Ä¢ Participate in project meetings and provide technical drafting support as needed



Quality Assurance and Compliance

‚Ä¢ Ensure all drawings comply with local building codes, zoning regulations, and industry standards

‚Ä¢ Perform quality checks on drawings for accuracy, completeness, and proper layer management

‚Ä¢ Verify dimension accuracy and coordinate information between different drawing types

‚Ä¢ Maintain drawing libraries and standard details for efficient project delivery

‚Ä¢ Review completed drawings for errors, omissions, and compliance with project specifications





Documentation and Communication

‚Ä¢ Maintain organized project files and drawing archives

‚Ä¢ Prepare drawing lists and project documentation packages

‚Ä¢ Communicate effectively with team members regarding drawing status and requirements

‚Ä¢ Assist in preparing permit submissions and construction document packages

‚Ä¢ Provide technical support to construction teams and field personnel as needed





Required Qualifications



Education

‚Ä¢ Associate degree or certificate in Architectural Drafting, CAD Technology, or related field

‚Ä¢ Equivalent combination of education and relevant experience will be considered





Experience

‚Ä¢ Minimum 3-5 years of professional drafting experience in architectural or construction industry

‚Ä¢ Proven track record of creating complete sets of construction documents

‚Ä¢ Experience with both residential and commercial projects preferred





Technical Skills

‚Ä¢ **AutoCAD:** Advanced proficiency with current version (AutoCAD 2020 or newer)

- Experience with layer management, blocks, external references, and customizing workspace

- Knowledge of dimensioning standards and annotation styles

- Ability to create and manage drawing templates and standards

‚Ä¢ **Chief Architect:** Intermediate to advanced proficiency

- Experience creating 3D models and generating construction documents

- Knowledge of building templates, library management, and custom cabinets

- Ability to produce renderings and walkthroughs for client presentations





Core Competencies

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of architectural design principles and construction methods

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of building codes, zoning regulations, and accessibility requirements

‚Ä¢ Excellent attention to detail with ability to maintain high accuracy in drawings

‚Ä¢ Strong problem-solving skills and ability to interpret complex technical information

‚Ä¢ Effective time management with ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously

‚Ä¢ Excellent written and verbal communication skills

‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team











Equipment and Software

‚Ä¢ High-performance computer workstation with dual monitors

‚Ä¢ Latest versions of AutoCAD, Chief Architect, and supporting software

‚Ä¢ Access to large-format plotters and printing equipment

‚Ä¢ Standard office equipment and communication tools





Compensation and Benefits



Salary

‚Ä¢ Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications

‚Ä¢ Annual performance reviews and opportunities for advancement

‚Ä¢ Overtime compensation as applicable



Application Deadline



Applications will be accepted until the position is filled. Early applications are encouraged as interviews will be conducted on a rolling basis.

title: TELEMARKETING, Virtual Assistant
description:
Your skills and time are needed by my company to help me reach potential clients at an affordable rate.



Please let me know if you are available to work 4-8-12 hour shifts from Monday - Friday



When hospices do not have nurses available to take care of their dying patient's they call companies like mine to ask us to send nurses 24 hours a day for a few days while their patient's are dying. We then send nurses for 8 hour shifts to the patient's and the nurses alternate so that we can provide the hospice patients with 24 hours of continuous care for the few days at the end of a patient's life.



The right candidate will be able to cold call Hospices in Southern California (United States) from a list of hospices I have, and attempt to get them to sign a contract so that my company can provide them with nursing services.



Please let Ella/Kathy know if you are available to work and interested in the opportunity via
 at

Subject line: Hire me



Thanks,



Jared Larner, LVN; CEO & Founder

(818)
HOSPICE ALLIANCE NETWORK

title: Retail & Distributor Outreach & Sales Support Assistant (Part-Time, Remote) plus commissions & bonuses
description:
About the Role



I‚Äôm the founder of a growing natural, vegan skincare and sunscreen brand based in the UK. I‚Äôm looking for a reliable, detail-oriented assistant to help manage outreach to retail stockists and distributors.



This role is suited to someone with sales or lead-generation experience who understands wholesale ecosystems and can confidently distinguish between brands, retailers/stockists, distributors, and competitors.



You‚Äôll be responsible for keeping a high-quality outreach pipeline active and organised. I will handle closing and final negotiations.



Hours & Schedule



- Independent contractor role (hourly)



- Part-time: 12 hours per week



- Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday



- 4 hours per day



- Some overlap with UK business hours required



- Start date: ASAP



- Long-term role for the right person





Key Responsibilities



Outreach & Follow-Ups



- Send outreach
s to appropriate retail stockists and distributors



- Personalise
s thoughtfully (not mass outreach)



- Adapt and improve outreach templates over time



- Manage follow-ups and track responses clearly





Lead sourcing & tracking



- Track every account in a simple pipeline tracker or spreadsheet



- Correctly classify leads as:

   

        - Company-Sourced (we provide the target company; you find contacts and manage follow-up)

        - Assistant-Sourced (you independently identify a suitable retail stockist or distributor)



- Use judgement to flag borderline, strategic, or unsuitable accounts before outreach



- Confirm sourcing status in the tracker if unclear before spending time on it





Sales Cycle & Pipeline Support



- Support the sales process from prospecting to warm lead handover



- Qualify retailers and distributors based on brand fit



- Maintain clear notes on outreach status and next steps





Research & Prospecting



- Research and identify genuine multi-brand retail stockists and aligned distributors



- Identify correct buyers, founders, or category contacts



- Build and maintain a curated outreach list (quality over volume)





Communication & Reporting



- Clearly summarise replies and actions required



- Flag interested or time-sensitive leads promptly



- Maintain an organised spreadsheet or CRM





Requirements



- Experience in wholesale sales, B2B outreach, account management, or lead generation



- Clear understanding of the difference between:



            - brands vs retailers/stockists

            - competitors vs wholesale accounts

            - boutiques vs large chains



- Understanding of the sales cycle and follow-up process



- Strong written English



- Excellent organisation and attention to detail



- Confident researching companies and decision-makers



- Comfortable using Google Sheets and/or CRMs (PipeDrive a plus)



- LinkedIn outreach experience preferred





What This Role Is Not



- No cold calling



- No closing or negotiation



- No aggressive sales tactics





Tools



-  Gmail



- Google Sheets or CRM (PipeDrive)



- Templates, training, and brand materials provided



- Hubstaff used for time tracking (not micromanagement)





Pay



- PHP 250/hour, paid monthly



- Commission applies to the first paid order only from Assistant-Sourced accounts



- One-off bonuses apply to Company-Sourced accounts



- Commission/bonuses paid after cleared payment is received



(At 12 hours/week, approx. PHP 12,900/month + bonuses.)



How to Apply



 
 with ref SO26 and include:



- A short summary of your experience with sales, outreach, or wholesale support



- How you track outreach and follow-ups



- A short sample outreach
 introducing a natural skincare brand to a retail stockist



-A 1‚Äì2 minute Loom video explaining why you‚Äôre interested in this specific role and Baie Botanique



NB: Applications without a Loom link will not be reviewed.

title: Automotive parts data analyst
description:
We are a growing company in the automotive industry and are looking for a highly accurate and analytical tea
mber to support us with product research, price analysis, and inventory decisions.

?



Responsibilities

?

?

 ‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently

 ‚Ä¢ Ability to think about pricing strategy

?



Ideal Candidate

title: HR Operations Administrator (Remote ‚Äì Philippines)
description:
About the Role



Eco Property Maintenance is a growing Canadian property maintenance company with ~25+ field staff. We are hiring a full-time HR Operations Administrator to own and execute our people processes ‚Äî hiring support, onboarding, offboarding, employee records, and HR administration. You will work from clear SOPs, checklists, and scripts, and escalate decisions when required.



If you are highly organized, detail-oriented, confident communicating in English, and experienced supporting North American companies remotely ‚Äî this role will be a great fit.



Key Responsibilities



1. Hiring & Recruitment Support

-Maintain and post job ads across platforms (e.g. Indeed)

-Screen resumes against defined criteria

-Conduct initial screening calls with candidates

-Record call notes and candidate details in our HR system (BambooHR or tracker)

-Complete interviews / record to share with managers

-Track candidates through the hiring pipeline

-Maintain organized hiring records and status updates

-Coordinate trial days with zone managers



2. Onboarding (Primary Focus)

-Send onboarding packages to new hires (contracts, tax forms, personal info forms, etc.)

-Track completion of all onboarding documents

-Maintain and follow onboarding checklists

-Ensure system access, documentation, and setup steps are completed

-Ensure every new hire receives a consistent onboarding experience



3. Off boarding

-Trigger and manage off boarding checklists

-Prepare and process ROEs

-Coordinate benefits cancellation

-Collect company property (documentation + tracking)

-Conduct exit interviews using provided scripts

-Log and categorize exit reasons for management review



4. HR Administration & Compliance Tracking

-Maintain up-to-date employee records

-Track required documents and certifications

-Monitor WCB-related documentation and requirements

-Flag missing or expired documents

-Escalate compliance issues to management when needed

-(You will not interpret employment law ‚Äî only track and report)



5. Employee Support & Engagement (Structured)

-Schedule and support periodic employee check-ins

-Assist with performance review scheduling

-Track goals and follow-ups for field staff

-Collect employee feedback using structured questions

-Summarize trends and insights for management



What This Role Is NOT

-Making hiring or termination decisions

-Interpreting employment law or policies

-Handling employee conflicts independently

-Negotiating compensation or benefits

-Creating policy without approval

-You will execute processes, document outcomes, and escalate when guidance is needed.



Required Qualifications

-2+ years experience in HR administration, recruitment support, or people operations

-Experience supporting North American (US or Canadian) companies

-Fluent spoken and written English (required)

-Comfortable running screening calls independently

-Strong attention to detail and follow-up

-Confident using checklists, trackers, and SOPs

-Reliable internet and professional remote setup



Preferred Qualifications

Tools You‚Äôll Use

 / Zoom)
