title: Lead Manager & CRM Admin (RESimpli) ‚Äì Land & Homes
description:
We are a real estate investment company buying Vacant Land, Houses, and Mobile Home Parks. We run everything through one master pipeline in RESimpli.



We are looking for a detailed Lead Manager to keep this pipeline moving. Your job is to ensure that no lead gets stuck. You will categorize incoming leads (House vs. Land), ensure they are in the correct stage, and set tasks for our Acquisitions Manager (AM) and Dispositions Manager (DM) so they can focus on buying/selling. You must know RESimpli inside and out to manage multiple pipelines for different asset types (minimum one year experience with RESimpli required).



Key Responsibilities:



1. Pipeline Movement (The "Flow" Manager):



‚Ä¢ Prevent Stagnation: You must monitor our "New Leads" and "Follow Up" stages daily. If a lead has been sitting in a stage for too long without a note or a next task, you must flag it or move it.



‚Ä¢ Stage Management: Ensure leads are physically moved in RESimpli from "New Lead" ? "No Contact Made" ? "Due Diligence" ? "Offer Made" etc etc. A lead should never sit in the wrong stage.



2. Asset Categorization (Tagging):



‚Ä¢ Identification: Since we use one pipeline for everything, you must identify the asset type immediately.

    ? Land: Tag as LAND. Check for wetlands/access.

    ? House: Tag as HOUSE. Check condition/year built.

    ? Commercial/Park: Tag as PARK.



‚Ä¢ Note Taking: You must clearly note the asset details at the top of the file so the Acquisitions Manager knows exactly what they are looking at before they call.



3. Basic CRM Admin:



‚Ä¢ Data Entry: Update seller information and property details in RESimpli.

‚Ä¢ Builder Updates: Enter new builder buying criteria into BuyerBridge.ai when our team secures a new buyer relationship.

‚Ä¢ Contract Drafting: Generate standard contracts in RESimpli/DocuSign for the team to review (basic fill-in-the-blank).

Requirements:

‚Ä¢ RESimpli Familiarity: You do not need to be a tech wizard, but you must know how to navigate the dashboard, move leads, add tags, and set tasks, and use other tech tools.

‚Ä¢ High Attention to Detail: You are the person who ensures the data is accurate.

‚Ä¢ Asset Knowledge: Basic understanding of the difference between a vacant lot (wetlands/access) and a single-family home. Experience with mobile homes or RV's a plus.

‚Ä¢ English Proficiency: Fluent written English for notes and basic communications.



How to Apply: Simply reply to this job post with the answers to these 3 questions:



1. If you see a lead sitting in the "New Leads" stage for 5 days with no notes, what would you do?

2. How would you note a "Mobile Home Park" differently than a "Vacant Lot" in the CRM so our Acquisition Manager notices it immediately?

3. On a scale of 1-10, how comfortable are you navigating RESimpli?

4. Do you have experience with both homes and vacant land?

5. Do you have experience doing due diligence on properties? If so, please explain?

6. Do you have experience with setting up and managing Slack for a team?

description:

mbers to integrate Zoho applications with other systems and third-party APIs.

title: Full-Time Remote Operations & Leasing Coordinator ‚Äì Co-Living Property Business (PH-based Long-Term Contractor Role)
description:
About Us

We operate a growing co-living accommodation business in Australia focused on providing clean, well-managed, professional share housing. We are expanding and are hiring a full-time Remote Operations & Leasing Coordinator to manage enquiries, tenant communication, rent follow-ups, and day-to-day coordination and helping source new opportunities.

This is a long-term role with growth potential as the portfolio expands.

________________________________________

 Role Overview

You will be the first point of contact for prospective tenants and the central coordinator for ongoing tenant communication and operations.

This is a fast-response, detail-driven role. Occupancy and professionalism matter.

You will work directly with the founder.

________________________________________

Key Responsibilities

Leasing & Enquiries

‚Ä¢ Monitor and respond to
 Marketplace and online enquiries

‚Ä¢ Qualify prospects using set criteria

‚Ä¢ Organise and confirm inspections

‚Ä¢ Follow up enquiries to maximise conversion

‚Ä¢ Maintain enquiry-to-lease tracker

Tenant Communication

‚Ä¢ Respond to day-to-day tenant messages

‚Ä¢ Send move-in and move-out instructions and onboarding information

‚Ä¢ Maintain organised tenant records

‚Ä¢ Enforce house rules professionally

Rent & Arrears Management

‚Ä¢ Monitor rent payments daily

‚Ä¢ Send reminders for overdue rent

‚Ä¢ Follow structured arrears follow-up process

‚Ä¢ Escalate serious cases

Operations Coordination

‚Ä¢ Schedule cleaners between tenancies

‚Ä¢ Log maintenance issues and track until resolved

‚Ä¢ Update occupancy spreadsheet

‚Ä¢ Prepare weekly summary report

________________________________________

Working Hours

3-4 days a week or Full-time 

Must be online and responsive during agreed shift hours aligned with Sydney time.

Target response time during shift: under 10‚Äì15 minutes.

________________________________________

Performance Expectations

‚Ä¢ Fast response time to enquiries

‚Ä¢ High inspection booking rate

‚Ä¢ Strong follow-up discipline

‚Ä¢ Low rent arrears

‚Ä¢ Accurate and organised records

‚Ä¢ Professional tone in all communication

________________________________________

Requirements

‚Ä¢ Excellent written English (clear, confident, professional)

‚Ä¢ Strong organisational ability

‚Ä¢ Comfortable handling multiple conversations simultaneously

‚Ä¢ Able to follow structured SOPs

‚Ä¢ Reliable internet and quiet workspace

‚Ä¢ Previous property management or customer support experience preferred

________________________________________

Compensation

Competitive monthly salary based on experience.

Performance-based bonus tied to occupancy and arrears KPIs.

Long-term growth opportunity into senior operations role.

________________________________________

How to Apply (Mandatory)

To be considered, include:

1. Please send CV and 2‚Äì3 minute video introduction.

2. A written response to this scenario:

A prospective tenant messages at 6:30pm asking if the room is still available. Outline exactly what you would say and the steps you would take to convert this enquiry into a confirmed inspection.

3. Your expected monthly salary for full-time work.

Applications without these will not be reviewed.

s via Google Workspace

title: Strategic Sales Partner
description:
* ** Please apply for this position using the following URL: 
 ***



ABOUT KAITERRA:

We spend 90% of our time indoors, where air quality directly impacts our health, well-being, and overall comfort.



At Kaiterra, we believe our buildings should not only be safe and healthy but also enhance the quality of life for those inside them. That‚Äôs why we create innovative environmental monitoring devices and intelligent software analytics, combined with world-class professional consultation services, to help leading companies worldwide transform their built environments.



Our clients include some of the world‚Äôs most respected companies‚ÄîMicrosoft, LinkedIn, Google, and Apple, to name a few. They come to us for solutions to complex challenges in their environments, and we work with them to create healthier, safer, and smarter spaces.



If you‚Äôre looking to join a purpose-driven organization making a tangible impact on the human experience, Kaiterra could be the perfect fit for you.



ABOUT THE ROLE:

We are seeking a business-savvy and hyper-organized Strategic Sales Partner to act as the "right hand" to our Senior Account Executive. This is not a standard "Virtual Assistant" role; it requires a commercial mindset, sharp judgment, and the ability to navigate complex deal cycles.



In this role, you will be responsible for strategic alignment: you will "brain sync" with the AE, anticipating needs before they are spoken. You will have the autonomy to manage the operational engine of the sales process - from researching key stakeholders to chasing internal legal teams - ensuring the AE can focus 100% on closing revenue. Crucially, you will act as a strategic gatekeeper. You will ensure that no deal stalls because of paperwork, and no meeting happens without a clear objective and research dossier.



Location: Remote (Philippines / Vietnam / Thailand preferred) 

Job Type: Full-Time (Must overlap with North American Business Hours) 

Reporting to: Senior Account Executive



WHAT YOU'LL DO:



1. Strategic Deal Orchestration

- Shadow Management: Attend client meetings and forecast calls to capture nuances, action items, and "read the room." You don't just take notes; you identify the "unspoken" risks and next steps.

- Stakeholder Mapping: Conduct efficient research to build "dossiers" on key decision-makers. You will maintain a live "Power Map" in the CRM, identifying who the Champions and Detractors are for every major deal.

- Pre-Meeting Intelligence: Before the AE talks to a CIO, you provide the briefing: recent news, financial reports, and strategic priorities. You ensure the AE never walks into a meeting unprepared.



2. Operational Execution & Internal Navigation

- Pipeline Hygiene: Own the CRM (HubSpot/Salesforce) accuracy. You ensure every opportunity is updated, stages are correct, and close dates are realistic. The AE should never have to manually enter data.

- Internal "Paperwork" Walking: Drive the deal process internally. You are the one chasing Legal, Finance, and Security teams to get contracts approved. You unblock the internal bottlenecks so the deal doesn't stall.



3. Administrative Leverage ("The Time Defender")

- Inbox Triage: Manage the AE‚Äôs inbox to prioritize high-value client
s versus internal noise. You draft replies for approval to speed up response times and ensure no VIP client is left waiting.

- Calendar Strategy: Aggressively guard the AE‚Äôs time. If a client meeting moves, you immediately reshuffle internal commitments to ensure the AE preserves "deep work" blocks for prospecting.



4. Continuous Improvement

- Process Optimization: Actively identify bottlenecks in the sales admin process. If you see a repetitive task, you build a template or a workflow to fix it.



WHAT YOU'LL BRING:

Education:

- A Bachelor's degree is required to demonstrate foundational academic qualifications for this strategic role.



Experience:

- Proven Business Experience: Minimum 2+ years in a high-performance professional environment. We highly value backgrounds in Management Consulting or Sales Operations.

- Experience with CRM platforms, HubSpot preferred, is required for managing pipeline accuracy and data integrity.

- Experience supporting senior executives or working in a fast-paced tech startup is a strong plus.



Skills & Core Competencies:

- "Brain Sync" Ability: High Emotional Intelligence (EQ). You can read between the lines of a meeting and understand the strategic context of a deal without needing everything explained.

- Strategic AI Usage: You use Gemini as a force multiplier, not a crutch. You know how to prompt for research and drafting to work 10x faster, but you never blindly copy-paste. You fact-check every output to ensure accuracy and ensure the final tone is human and strategic.

- Technical Precision: Mastery of Google Sheets/Excel, document sand presentation software. You are the person who catches the typo in the contract that everyone else missed.

- Operational Rigor: You are hyper-organized. You don't wait for instructions; you see a problem (e.g., "This contract is stuck in Legal") and you fix it.

- High-Velocity Communication: You are an exceptional writer. You can draft professional, "executive-ready"
s that sound exactly like the AE.



* ** Please apply for this position using the following URL: 
 ***

title: Patient Care Coordinator
description:
We are looking for a highly motivated and experienced Remote Patient Services Representative based in the Philippines. The ideal candidate will manage inbound and outbound calls, assist patients with scheduling appointments, address inquiries, and perform other related tasks to ensure a seamless patient experience.



Key Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Answer incoming calls promptly and professionally.

‚Ä¢ Schedule, reschedule, and confirm patient appointments using our electronic health record (EHR) system.

‚Ä¢ Provide accurate information regarding services, insurance, and payment options.

‚Ä¢ Address patient inquiries and concerns with empathy and efficiency.

‚Ä¢ Maintain and update patient records with a high degree of accuracy.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with the optometry team to ensure optimal patient care.



Performance Metrics:

To ensure excellence in patient service, the following performance metrics will be used to evaluate success in this role:

‚Ä¢ Average Handle Time (AHT): The average duration of a patient interaction, including talk time, hold time, and after-call work. Efficiently managing AHT ensures timely assistance to patients while maintaining service quality. ?

‚Ä¢ Quality Score: Assessment of call quality based on adherence to protocols, accuracy of information provided, and overall patient interaction effectiveness. High-quality scores reflect a commitment to excellence in patient care.

‚Ä¢ Patient Satisfaction Score: A measure of patient contentment with the service provided, often gathered through post-interaction surveys. High scores indicate successful patient engagement and issue resolution.

‚Ä¢ Service Level: The percentage of calls answered within a specified timeframe, reflecting the ability to meet patient demand promptly. Maintaining a high service level ensures patient satisfaction and loyalty. ?

‚Ä¢ Appointment Scheduling Rate: The efficiency and accuracy in scheduling patient appointments, ensuring optimal utilization of clinic time and resources.



Qualifications:

‚Ä¢ Proven experience in a customer service role, preferably in a medical or optometry setting.

‚Ä¢ Exceptional verbal and written English communication skills.

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with EHR systems and medical scheduling software is a plus.

‚Ä¢ Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently and manage time effectively.

‚Ä¢ Stable internet connection and a quiet workspace conducive to professional phone conversations.



Work Schedule:

‚Ä¢ Full-time position.

‚Ä¢ Must be available to work U.S. business hours, including potential evening shifts to accommodate different time zones.



To Qualify, please complete the Assessment below:



1. Application form: wkf.ms/45nfpCJ

2. Complete this assessment:

title: Marketing Assistant (Performance Ops, Partnerships & Content)
description:
Description

We‚Äôre a fast-growing agency supporting digital creators. We‚Äôre hiring a Marketing Assistant to support the day-to-day execution of our marketing operation ‚Äî keeping performance data organised, partner communication running smoothly, and content workflows clean and consistent.

This role is ideal for someone who‚Äôs sharp, reliable, and comfortable working with numbers. You don‚Äôt need to be a ‚Äúmarketing genius,‚Äù but you do need to be the type of person who keeps systems tight and spots issues early.



Working Hours / Setup

Remote

Full Time

Mon‚ÄìFri: 12:00 PM ‚Äì 8:00 PM GMT

Sat‚ÄìSun: 12:00 PM ‚Äì 4:00 PM GMT



The Mission

Your mission is to keep our marketing engine operating at a high standard. Success looks like:

Performance data is accurate, structured, and easy to read

Key metrics are tracked consistently and surfaced quickly

Spreadsheets and reporting stay clean and up to date

3rd-party partners receive fast, professional communication

Content is generated, organised, and ready for distribution

Execution is fast, consistent, and detail-perfect





What You‚Äôll Own

1) Marketing Performance Support

Track performance metrics across campaigns and channels

Flag anomalies early (drops/spikes) and escalate appropriately

Assist with weekly performance summaries and reporting





2) Spreadsheet & Data Management (Core)

Maintain tracking sheets and datasets with high accuracy

Use formulas for basic analysis (totals, % change, averages, lookups)

Keep data clean, consistent, and easy for the team to use





3) Partner Communications

Manage day-to-day communication with 3rd-party partners

Keep partner information organised and maintained

Escalate issues/opportunities quickly to the right person





4) Content Ops

Support content generation using simple AI tools (easy to learn)

Organise content libraries and assets for fast internal access

Quality-check content for consistency and readiness



Who We‚Äôre Looking For

C2 English (written and spoken)

Strong with numbers and comfortable working with metrics (math skills required)

Confident with Google Sheets (including formulas and structured tracking)

Extremely reliable with fast response times

Organised, proactive, and able to manage multiple workstreams

Calm under pressure and execution-focused

Tech-savvy and quick to learn new platforms/tools



Training & Onboarding

You‚Äôll be trained directly by our Director, including:

Our tracking, reporting, and workflow standards

Communication expectations and escalation processes

Content workflows and internal tools



Culture Fit (Important)

We value ownership, speed, and accuracy. This role is ideal for someone who:

Communicates clearly and follows through

Takes pride in clean execution and organised systems

Thinks ahead, flags issues early, and doesn‚Äôt need to be chased



Compensation

$5 USD/hour (paid in crypto)

Discretionary performance-based bonuses

title: Youtube Faceless Video Scriptwriter for NBA Player/Documnentary
description:

- Humble beginnings

I have attached a YouTube Channel Here:

Thank You!

title: Paralegal
description:
About Us



We are a private U.S. company seeking a detail-oriented, organized, and proactive Paralegal to join our legal team. If you thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment and have a passion for supporting legal operations, we want to hear from you!



Responsibilities



-Draft, review, and organize legal documents such as contracts, pleadings, and correspondence

-Conduct legal and factual research; summarize findings for attorney review

-Manage case files, document databases, and filing systems to ensure accuracy and accessibility

-Assist with preparation of materials for hearings, depositions, and trials

-Coordinate communications with clients, courts, and external counsel

-File and track legal documents with courts and regulatory bodies

-Maintain calendars, track deadlines, and ensure timely completion of filings and tasks

-Support due diligence and compliance-related initiatives as needed



Qualifications



-Associate‚Äôs degree or equivalent education and/or experience in a legal or administrative setting

-Strong organizational and communication skills

-Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook)

-Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines

-Exceptional attention to detail and commitment to accuracy

-Ability to handle confidential information with discretion



How to Apply



Please submit your resume via a Google Drive link (set to public/viewer) and include ‚ÄúParalegal‚Äù in the subject line. All information will be kept confidential and used solely for recruitment.



Note: This is a direct hire opportunity with a private U.S. company, not an agency.

title: Client Portal & Onboarding Support Specialist
description:
About the Role



We are looking for a reliable and detail-oriented Client Portal & Onboarding Support Specialist to manage client communication inside our portal and ensure every client successfully completes onboarding without delays. Your main responsibility is to keep all client files moving and prevent inactivity.

-
/
 relationships with project founders or marketing heads

 handle

title: Senior AWS Engineer ‚Äì AWS Cost Optimization & Kubernetes
description:
Job Description:

About the Role

We're a blockchain/DeFi company running production infrastructure that's bleeding money unnecessarily. Our AWS bill is sitting at $4,500/month ‚Äì and we know it shouldn't be anywhere near that. We need someone who can come in, audit the whole setup, and actually fix it. Not just give us a report that sits in a folder.



We've already been through a few candidates who talked a big game but couldn't execute. We're done with that. If you're the type who needs handholding or can't work independently, this isn't for you.





What You'll Actually Do

- Audit our entire AWS infrastructure and identify exactly where we're wasting money (we expect significant savings)

- Optimize our Kubernetes clusters ‚Äì right-size nodes, fix resource requests/limits, implement autoscaling that actually works

- Implement cost controls: Reserved Instances, Savings Plans, spot instances where appropriate, and cleanup of orphaned resources

- Set up monitoring and alerts so costs don't creep back up without us knowing

- Document everything you do so the team can maintain it





Hard Requirements (Non-Negotiable)

- 3+ years hands-on Kubernetes experience in production environments ‚Äì EKS specifically preferred

- Deep AWS knowledge: EC2, EKS, RDS, S3, CloudWatch, Cost Explorer, Trusted Advisor

- Proven track record of actually reducing AWS costs (be ready to share numbers/percentages)

- Strong scripting skills (Python, Bash) for automation

- Infrastructure as Code: Terraform or CloudFormation (Terraform preferred)

- Self-starter who can take ownership and execute without constant oversight





!!!!CRITICAL: This Role Requires Surgical Precision

This is production infrastructure running live systems. Think of this like surgery ‚Äì one wrong move can take everything down.

- NO cowboy moves. You don't delete, modify, or remove anything without a clear plan first.

- Every change must be planned out, documented, and confirmed with the CEO before execution.

- Extreme attention to detail. You double-check and triple-check before touching anything.

- If you're not 100% sure what something does, you ask first. You don't assume.

- Methodical execution only. We value careful and correct over fast and reckless.





Strong Plus

- Experience with blockchain/Web3 infrastructure

- Karpenter, Cluster Autoscaler, or KEDA experience

-  AWS certifications (Solutions Architect, DevOps Engineer)

- Experience with FinOps tools (Kubecost, CloudHealth, 
)





What We Need In Your Application

Don't send a generic application. We will ignore it. Include:

- Specific examples of AWS cost optimization you've done ‚Äì what was the setup, what did you change, what % did you save?

- Your Kubernetes experience ‚Äì cluster sizes you've managed, scaling strategies you've implemented

- Your availability and timezone (we need someone who can overlap with US business hours for some calls)





Compensation & Structure

- $20-25/hour based on experience and proven results

- 20 hours/week to start ‚Äì potential for more hours for the right person

- Fully remote

- Initial project: Comprehensive audit + implementation plan with clear cost reduction targets





If you're someone who can actually deliver results and not just talk about them ‚Äì we want to hear from you. Show us what you've done.

title: Senior Full-Stack Developer (DeFi and NFT Projects)
description:
About Energi

Energi (NRG) is a scalable and secure blockchain ecosystem, designed to power the next generation of Web3 applications, DeFi protocols, and NFT marketplaces. Built on a robust Proof of Stake (PoS) infrastructure, Energi combines Ethereum compatibility, on-chain governance, a self-funding treasury, and a Layer 2 masternode network to drive innovation in decentralized technology.

Our remote-first team spans the Americas, Europe, Africa, Asia, and Oceania, working together to push the boundaries of blockchain scalability and security. With a growing network of global contributors, we are committed to building a blockchain that is not only secure but also developer-friendly and highly scalable.

Energi is engineered to support millions of users, making it an ideal platform for high-performance dApps, NFT marketplaces, and decentralized finance solutions. Our ecosystem is designed for fast, cost-effective transactions with a focus on long-term sustainability.

By fostering collaboration, innovation, and a forward-thinking culture, Energi is redefining the Web3 landscape. Explore our vision and mission at 
.





WHAT‚ÄôS IN IT FOR YOU:

-Work flexible hours from anywhere as part of a globally distributed team driven by innovation and shared values.

-Directly shape the future of blockchain technology in NFT development.

-Enhance your skills and creativity with cutting-edge blockchain, smart contract, and Web3 technologies.

-Be part of an advanced blockchain ecosystem and contribute to building next-gen NFT platforms.

-Competitive pay structure in a 50/50 split of ETH and NRG tokens.



Front-End Role

JOB OVERVIEW:

We seek a Blockchain Full-Stack Engineer specializing in NFT platforms to drive the front-end development of our decentralized applications. You‚Äôll create immersive Web3 experiences while integrating blockchain-based features like Metamask and smart contracts.



JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

-Work closely with UX designers to create seamless NFT marketplaces and dApps.

-Develop interactive front-end features integrating Web3.js and smart contracts.

-Optimize UI performance and ensure mobile responsiveness.

-Maintain existing applications and introduce new blockchain features.



ESSENTIAL REQUIREMENTS:

-3+ years of experience in front-end development.

-Proficient in React, Gatsby, and Web3 frameworks.

-Experience integrating blockchain wallets like Metamask.

-Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.

-Fluent English communicator with a passion for blockchain.



NICE TO HAVE:

-Experience with Web3, Infura, and The Graph.

-Familiarity with NFT metadata standards and ERC-721/ERC-1155.

-SEO optimization skills.



Back-End Role

JOB OVERVIEW:

We‚Äôre looking for a Blockchain Full-Stack Engineer to build the backend for NFT applications. You‚Äôll be responsible for designing, maintaining, and optimizing APIs that connect blockchain smart contracts with scalable Web3 applications.



JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

-Develop secure APIs that interact with NFT smart contracts.

-Optimize backend infrastructure for high-traffic NFT transactions.

-Implement blockchain indexing solutions for NFT metadata retrieval.

-Write unit tests to ensure security and efficiency.



ESSENTIAL REQUIREMENTS:

-3+ years of back-end development experience.

-Proficiency in Golang, NodeJS, and GraphQL.

-Experience with blockchain data structures and decentralized storage.

-Passionate about blockchain innovation and fluent in English.



NICE TO HAVE:

-Knowledge of smart contract security best practices.

-Prior experience with NFT minting platforms.

-Remote work experience.



This role is not open to 3rd party organizations or agencies. Any candidates sent will be considered free of any charges



Energi is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics.

title: Insurance Collections Specialist
description:
#Direct Client

#PST Hours ONLY



The Insurance Collections Specialist is a proactive problem-solver responsible for managing the accounts receivable lifecycle and ensuring accurate reimbursement from third-party payers. You will investigate claim denials, file strategic appeals, and resolve billing discrepancies to maintain the clinic‚Äôs financial health. This role requires a blend of technical coding knowledge and persistent communication to turn outstanding claims into recovered revenue.



Monitor Accounts Receivable (AR) aging reports to identify unpaid claims and prioritize follow-up based on dollar amount and timely filing limits.



Investigate denied, rejected, or partially paid claims by reviewing payer portals and communicating directly with insurance representatives.



Resubmit corrected claims with necessary documentation, such as medical records, invoices, or Certificates of Medical Necessity.



Manage the appeals process, drafting formal appeal letters for clinical or administrative denials.  



Verify insurance coverage and benefits when discrepancies arise during the billing cycle to ensure accurate claim adjudication.



Identify and report recurring payer trends that lead to denials, assisting the management team in proactive "clean claim" strategies.



Maintain updated knowledge of ICD-10, CPT, and HCPCS codes, as well as evolving payer-specific policies.



Document all collection activity clearly and concisely within the Practice Management (PM) system. 



Process adjustments and write-offs in accordance with clinic policy and contractual obligations.



Collaborate with the Coding and Authorization departments to resolve root-cause issues that prevent payment.



Screening Questions



How many years of experience do you have with Insurance Collections or Accounts Receivable follow-up in a US medical billing environment?



Please list the Practice Management systems, clearinghouses, or payer portals you have used and indicate your proficiency level (Beginner / Intermediate / Advanced).



How often did you work AR aging reports, follow up on denied claims, and resolve insurance payment discrepancies in your previous roles?

(Daily / Weekly / Monthly)



What is your level of familiarity with ICD-10, CPT, and HCPCS coding standards, as well as payer-specific billing regulations?

Please rate your knowledge on a scale of 1 to 5 (1 = no knowledge, 5 = expert).



Please send your updated resume and answers to the screening questions below to: (

title: Coding and Clinical Documentation Specialist
description:
#Direct Client

#PST Hours ONLY



The Coding and Clinical Documentation Specialist is responsible for ensuring that clinical documentation accurately reflects the services provided and aligns with regulatory requirements. This role plays a key part in optimizing coding accuracy, improving reimbursement processes, and supporting the clinic's commitment to compliance and high-quality patient care. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in medical coding, clinical documentation improvement (CDI), and familiarity with telehealth standards.



Review and assign accurate ICD-10, CPT, and HCPCS codes to patient diagnoses and procedures, following industry and regulatory standards.

Work closely with clinical staff to ensure accurate and complete coding that reflects the services provided, maintaining compliance with federal and state regulations.

Monitor and apply updates to coding guidelines, ensuring that all codes reflect the most current practices.

Evaluate clinical documentation to ensure it supports the assigned codes and provides an accurate portrayal of patient health status and care provided.

Collaborate with healthcare providers to clarify documentation and provide guidance on proper coding practices to optimize coding accuracy.

Conduct regular documentation audits and develop improvement plans to address any identified gaps or discrepancies.

Ensure compliance with healthcare regulations, including HIPAA, CMS guidelines, and coding standards to minimize risk and protect patient information.

Participate in internal and external audits, providing documentation and insight to maintain compliance with coding standards.

Implement quality assurance measures to continually improve coding and documentation accuracy, reducing denials and optimizing reimbursement.



Screening Questions



How many years of experience do you have in medical coding or clinical documentation improvement (CDI) within a US healthcare environment?



Please list the coding software, EHR systems, or auditing tools you have used and indicate your proficiency level (Beginner / Intermediate / Advanced).



How often did you perform coding reviews, documentation audits, or provider queries in your previous roles?

(Daily / Weekly / Monthly)



What is your level of familiarity with ICD-10, CPT, and HCPCS coding standards, as well as CMS and HIPAA compliance requirements? Please rate your knowledge on a scale of 1 to 5 (1 = no knowledge, 5 = expert).



Please send your updated resume and answers to the screening questions below to: ( 
 )

title: Lead Generation & LinkedIn Outreach Specialist (SaaS ‚Äì Live Event Venues)
description:
We are a SaaS platform that helps live event venues improve profitability, financial visibility, and operational efficiency.

We are hiring a Lead Generation & LinkedIn Outreach Specialist to identify qualified venue operators, start conversations, and book demos. You are NOT selling. Your job is to qualify and schedule demos only.



This is a long-term role for someone reliable, detail-oriented, and professional.





## Your Responsibilities



You will be responsible for:



* Researching and sourcing qualified leads independently

* Identifying decision-makers (Owners, General Managers, Venue Directors, Operations Directors)

* Finding and verifying LinkedIn profiles

* Sending LinkedIn outreach messages using provided scripts

* Starting professional conversations with prospects

* Qualifying prospects based on provided criteria

* Booking demos when prospects are qualified

* Tracking all outreach and lead activity in Google Sheets



You must be comfortable sourcing your own leads. This is a core part of the role.



## Target Customers



We target independent live event venues with:



* 300‚Äì2,000 capacity

* Frequent live events

* Spreadsheet-based financial tracking

* Decision-makers responsible for operations and profitability



You will NOT contact assistants, marketing roles, or non-decision-makers.



## Monthly Performance Expectations



Expected performance per month:



* Source 400‚Äì800 qualified leads

* Send 300‚Äì500 outreach messages

* Book 8‚Äì20 qualified demos



Quality is more important than volume.



We focus on qualified demos, not spam.



## Requirements



Required:



* Strong written English

* Experience with lead generation, research, or outreach

* Experience using LinkedIn

* Strong attention to detail

* Ability to follow instructions carefully

* Reliable and consistent work habits



Preferred:



* SDR or appointment setting experience

* B2B outreach experience

* Lead generation experience



---



## Work Style Requirements



This role requires:



* Manual outreach only (no automation tools)

* Professional and respectful communication

* Strong organization and tracking

* Reliability and consistency



This is a long-term opportunity with growth potential.





## To Apply



Please include:



1. Your experience with lead generation or outreach

2. Your experience using LinkedIn

3. Your hourly rate

4. The word **VENUE** at the top of your application



Applications without the word VENUE will not be considered.

title: Sales Development Representative
description:
Do you enjoy turning outreach into real connections and helping a business grow? This role is more than just cold calls and
s. You will help a fast-growing US-based construction franchise by finding leads, qualifying them, following up, and moving them through the sales process. You will work closely with the franchise owner and a supportive team, helping with both sales and operational tasks along the way. If this sounds like a fit for you, we‚Äôre excited to review your application and meet you!



What Your Days Might Look Like:

- Conduct targeted research to identify high-value leads.

- Make around 50 outbound calls daily to warm-ish B2B leads.

- Qualify leads and manage follow-ups to keep the sales pipeline moving.

- Maintain CRM data, track all communications, tasks, and pipeline updates in HubSpot.

- Create and optimize scripts,
 templates, and outreach sequences.

- Take on operational tasks as needed to support the business.

- Work closely with the owner to prioritize outreach and identify opportunities for process improvements.



Who We Think Will Thrive in This Role:

- 3+ years of experience in outbound sales or cold calling.

- 1+ year of remote work experience.

- Comfortable working directly with a US-based client and open to feedback.

- Self-motivated, consistent in outreach, and confident in building relationships.

- Strong communication, collaboration, and organization skills.

- Proficient in English, multitasking, and using CRMs like HubSpot.

- Experience in commercial construction or as a team lead is a plus.



Why This Role Matters:

Every call,
, and follow-up helps the business grow. You are not just moving leads. You are helping the franchise succeed while learning and growing your skills in a remote environment.



Salary and Benefits:

- Base salary: 55k PHP per month

- Paid time off and paid holidays

- 100% remote

- Flexible schedule and supportive team



Important Reminder:

This company does not ask for any payments or fees as part of the employment process. If you encounter any request for payment, please ignore it and report it immediately. Make sure all communications come from official company
s 

Candidates who apply for this position may be considered for similar roles depending on their qualifications, experience, and current market needs.



When applying, please send your CV and copy and paste this into your
: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm excited to be applying to Job #rec4Wur7vrdBxLYyI!‚Äù This will let us know what job you‚Äôre applying for and show us that you read this entire job description (attention to detail is everything). Thanks and hope to hear from you soon!

title: URGENT HIRING: Virtual Assistant - Administrator, IT and Accounting Xero Certified and have Australian Accounting
description:
You only get one chance: carefully follow these instructions before applying or you will not hear from us. To apply you must visit our webpage 
/job-opportunities/undergraduate-to-senior-accountant/



Company: Health and Life



Location: Remote (with own internet and office facilities)



Job Type: Contract (may go long term depending on performance)



About Us:

Health and Life Access is a well-established healthcare consulting Chartered Accounting firm organisation specialising in the management of service entities and organizations throughout Australia and overseas. We are committed to creating a sustainable and socially responsible healthcare system.



Job Description:

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Virtual Assistant to provide administrative, IT, and accounting support to our organisation and clients. The successful candidate will report to the CEO and relevant supervisors, ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of our business.



Key Responsibilities:

Provide administrative, IT, and accounting support to the CEO and other consultants/managers.

Maintain accurate records, perform bookkeeping, and handle client billing.

Assist with financial reporting, budgeting, and petty cash management.

Manage calendars, appointments, and correspondence.

Develop and maintain effective working relationships with staff, clients, and suppliers.

Identify and resolve problems promptly, providing potential solutions.

Participate in special projects and additional duties as required.



Requirements:

Xero Certified and have Australian Accounting experience preferred.

Proven experience in administration, IT, and accounting.

Proficiency in using Google Suite, Xero, FileMaker Pro, and other software as specified.

Strong organisational and communication skills.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Commitment to maintaining confidentiality and adhering to ethical standards.

Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple tasks efficiently.



Working Conditions:

Standard 38-hour week, Monday to Friday, 8:30 am to 5:00 pm ACDT.

Flexible working hours may be required.

Must have own internet and office facilities.

No leave entitlement applies

All tasks are allocated by a Google calendar. The more you complete competently and within budget, the more work you generate.



Fees:

Task-based monthly fees up to $3,000 AUD or equivalent overseas currency. Long term contract positions available based on performance.



Fees reviewed based on performance; potential for multiple fee increases for good performance.



How to Apply:

If you are a motivated and detail-oriented individual with a passion for healthcare administration.



To apply visit our ‚ÄùUndergraduate up to senior accountant jobs‚Äù web page 
/job-opportunities/undergraduate-to-senior-accountant/.



Attention to detail matters, so read the application process carefully. You only get one chance.
